title: Rebellion
provenance_text:
Jon Corbino [1905-1964], New York, NY until October 1937 [1]; Charles J. Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA (Lugt Suppl. 633b), October 1937 until October 21, 1942 [1]; his gift to Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1942.

Notes:
[1]. The painting was no. 34 (illustrated, plate 35) in "The 1937 International Exhibition of Paintings" at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October-December 1937 (Macbeth Gallery, New York, NY as agent.) See "American Paintings and Sculpture to 1945 in the Carnegie Museum of Art," pages 146-147. 
[2]. Mr. Rosenbloom purchased the painting from the 1937 Carnegie International for $1,200; see copies of relevant digitized documents from Archives of American Art in curatorial file.
